summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-fourth Avenue Northwest, from Market Street to West Sixty-fifth Street; West Fifty-Sixth Street, from Twenty-fourth Avenue Northwest to Twenty-sixth Avenue Northwest; West Sixty-third Street, from Twentieth Avenue Northwest to Twenty-sixth Avenue Northwest, all in the City of Seattle, by regrading and curbing the same, and constructing concrete sidewalks with wooden crosswalks, in accordance with Resolution No. 781 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
